abstract.text: Creates a query for samples that match any of the descriptors you provided.

inlineContent.text: An array of descriptors that specify the types of samples that the query returns.
The maximum number of samples that the query return. If you want to return all matching samples, use
A block that the HealthKit store calls after it finishes executing the query.
This block takes the following parameters:
A reference to the query that called this block.
An array containing the samples the query found, or
if an error occurs.
If an error occurs, an object describing the error; otherwise, it’s
Use this initializer to create a sample query for data that matches any of the
objects. Each descriptor can specify a different data type.
After instantiating the query, call the
class’s

method to run this query. Queries run on an anonymous background queue. As soon as the query is complete, the system executes the results handler on the background queue, returning samples that match any of the descriptors. You typically dispatch these results to the main queue to update the user interface.
For example, the following code returns all the step count and push count samples:

code: let stepDescriptor = HKQueryDescriptor(sampleType: stepCountType, predicate: nil)
let pushDescriptor = HKQueryDescriptor(sampleType: pushCountType, predicate: nil)

abstract.text: Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
The access point for all data managed by HealthKit.
A value indicating that the query returns all the matching samples in the HealthKit store.
A descriptor that specifies a set of samples based on the data type and a predicate.
A HealthKit sample represents a piece of data associated with a start and end time.
A general query that returns a snapshot of all the matching samples currently saved in the HealthKit store.
Creates a query for samples that match any of the descriptors you provided.
Creates a query for samples that match any of the query descriptors you provided, sorted by the sort descriptors you provided.
Instantiates and returns a sample query.
Create, run, and sort sample queries.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
